Treatment: Mild cases can be treated with increased fluid intake and pain relief. Antibiotics are used when bacterial infection is confirmed. Cranberry supplements may help prevent recurrence.

Symptoms: Red spots that turn into blisters
Treatment: Usually resolves on its own with supportive care. Itching can be managed with antihistamines and calamine lotion. Fever can be treated with pain relievers. Itâ€™s important to avoid scratching to prevent scars.
Avoiding dairy or using lactose-free products is key. Lactase enzyme tablets may allow for consumption of small amounts of dairy. Calcium supplements are sometimes needed to prevent deficiency.

Drugs.Name: Lactaid
Drugs.Description: Lactase enzyme supplement to help digest lactose.

Treatment: Treatment includes regular physical activity, weight management, and joint-friendly exercises. Pain relievers and joint injections can help in advanced cases. Physical therapy and assistive devices can improve mobility.

Treatment varies depending on severity. Moisturizers and medicated creams are first-line treatments. In moderate-to-severe cases, light therapy or oral medications may be prescribed. Regular skin care and stress reduction help manage flare-ups.

Bronchitis treatment focuses on relieving symptoms. Rest and increased fluid intake help the body fight the infection. Cough suppressants may be used at night to ease sleep, but coughing is important to clear mucus. Avoid smoking or irritants. In bacterial cases, antibiotics might be prescribed.

Drugs.Name: Mucosolvan
Drugs.Description: Helps to loosen and clear mucus.

Treatment: Treatment involves avoiding irritants like alcohol, NSAIDs, and spicy foods. Acid-reducing medications help soothe the stomach lining. In cases linked to bacteria (H. pylori), specific antibiotics are necessary. Lifestyle changes including eating smaller, frequent meals improve symptoms.

Migraines can be managed by identifying and avoiding triggers such as certain foods, stress, or irregular sleep. Pain relief medications help during attacks. Preventive medications may be recommended if migraines are frequent. Lifestyle changes and stress management techniques improve quality of life.

Treatment involves regular gentle cleansing, avoiding oily cosmetics, and using topical medications to reduce bacteria and inflammation. In moderate to severe cases, oral antibiotics or hormonal treatments may be prescribed. Maintaining skin hygiene and avoiding picking are important.

UTIs are treated with a course of antibiotics tailored to the infection type. Drinking plenty of water helps flush the bacteria out. Pain relief medications may be used to ease discomfort. Completing the full course of treatment is important to prevent recurrence.

Managing eczema involves regular moisturizing, avoiding irritants like harsh soaps, and using topical corticosteroids during flare-ups. Identifying and avoiding triggers such as allergens or stress is key. In severe cases, immunomodulating medications may be prescribed.

CKD management focuses on controlling underlying causes such as diabetes and hypertension. Dietary changes, including reducing salt and protein intake, are important. Medications to control blood pressure and anemia are used. In advanced stages, dialysis or kidney transplantation may be required.

Drugs.Name: Lisinopril
Drugs.Description: Helps control blood pressure and protect kidneys.

Drugs.Name: Erythropoietin
Drugs.Description: Treats anemia related to kidney disease.

Treatment: Gout attacks are managed with anti-inflammatory medications and rest. Lifestyle changes include avoiding foods high in purines like red meat and alcohol. Long-term treatment focuses on lowering uric acid levels with medication to prevent attacks and joint damage.
